description.narrative: The project development objective is to enhance livelihood security and sustainability by scaling up institutional mechanisms that reduce the vulnerability of communities throughout Mongolia. SLPII will scale-up nationwide the effective mechanisms and processes piloted under the first phase in the local communities and governments. A wide range of environmentally sustainable, socially inclusive and economically viable project activities would help to preserve the ecological conditions and improve rural people's livelihood in a sustainable manner.

condition.narrative: Establish and maintain a Project Steering Committee for general oversight and policy coordination (throughout implementation)
Establish and maintain the Technical Working Groups with membership acceptable to the Association
Maintain the SLPO and its related offices with competent personnel satisfactory to the Association.
Maintain the Sustainable Livelihoods Project Councils and the Soum Governor Office to coordinate and implement activities underParts A and B of the project.
Provide semi annual reports on April 1 and Oct 1 each year

comment.narrative: Unavailable
No end of target was established for the indicator

title.narrative: Percentage of project-supported institutions that are reporting on this indicator
Increased income of loan beneficiaries at soum level and below.

target.value: 25 percent increase in annual income of Sub-borrowers at soum level andbelow measured from the baseline assessment conducted atstart of project implementation.

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
Data is being collected and will be available for the ICR

title.narrative: Component 1: Number of soums preparing, financing and implementing annual pasture-land management plans.

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
Target achieved

title.narrative: Component 2: Percentage of soums utlizing at least 80% of annual CIF allocation

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
Target achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of citizens who agree that CIF investments are aligned with their priorities

comment.narrative: Target Achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of public facility improvement sub-projects evaluated and accepted as good quality by State Inspection Agency

comment.narrative: Target achieved

title.narrative: Good Practices in pastoral livelihood improvement demonstrated in different agro-ecological zones

comment.narrative: Target achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of bagh citizens participating in bagh meetings

comment.narrative: Target achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of PFIs with non-performing loans of less than or equal to 5%

comment.narrative: Target achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of aimag and soum governments and herders receiving information from LEWS which is both regular and perceived useful

comment.narrative: Target achieved. In addition to targeted audience for specific areas, LEWS information is also made available through radio andtelevision and also on a website

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: There is no target value. This is a CDD project and project types are not pre-determined.

title.narrative: Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)

comment.narrative: This is a CDD component. Communities decide which investments will be supported. There is no requirement to use resource forhealthfacilities. The target value is therefore not applicable.

title.narrative: Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Percentage of herders and soum governments taking actions to mitigate pastoral risk (i.e., pasture land management and risk response plans developed and implemented).

target.value: 85 percent of Beneficiaries (i.e. herders, soum governments) taking actions to mitigate pastoral risk.

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
The end target has been achieved

title.narrative: Component 3: Total number of PFIs operating at soum level or below

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
Target achieved

title.narrative: Percentage of herders and local officers perceiving improvement in pasture land condition attributable to project interventions.

target.value: 85 percent of herders and local officers perceiving improvement in pastureland condition attributable to project interventions.

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
The end target has been achieved

title.narrative: Increased number of loan beneficiaries at soum level and below.

target.value: 35 percent increase in the number of Sub-borrowers at soum level and below measured from the baseline assessment conducted atstartof project implementation.

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
The end target has been achieved

title.narrative: Increased number of loan products accessible by poor rural citizens at soum level and below

comment.narrative: 35 percent increase in the number of sub-borrowers at soum level and below
68.4 percent increased attained

title.narrative: Percentage of citizens satisfied with the outcomes of CIF investment

target.value: 80 percent of Beneficiaries (i.e. citizens) satisfied with the mechanisms and outcomes of CIF Sub-projects.

comment.narrative: Re-set when Additional Financing approved by the Board in June 2011.
The end target has been achieved

title.narrative: Multi-level institutional framework for pastoral risk management established nationwide

target.value: legal framework for land and pasture management prepared and disseminated

actual.value: (i) Pasture Land Law; and (ii) Land Law are currently before parliament for enactment

comment.narrative: The target is partially achieved as the framework should have been established nationwide
